newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil sees cellular bid terms October 30 - report.
newsitem.headline: Brazil sees cellular bid terms October 30 - report.

text.p: Brazil's Communications Minister Sergio Motta said bid specifications for the upcoming privatization of Band B cellular services will be published on October 30, O Globo newspaper reported.
The paper cited Motta as saying he expects to sign transfer contracts for private-sector Band B concessions in 1997's first quarter.

Eighteen consortia, including foreign and local firms, have expressed interest in bidding on 10 Band B concessions across Brazil, which analysts say have a market value of about five billion reais, the paper said.
Brazil has passed a law opening the state monopoly of its lucrative telecoms industry to private capital but the government has failed to come up with enabling legislation.
On Wednesday, Motta said a draft bill creating a regulatory body for the Brazilian telecoms industry will be sent to Congress by October's end.
